author: Paul J. Davies
title: Why Private Equity Stocks Are Laggards of Finance
text:
The big beasts of private equity have been hugely successful at taking a bigger bite of the investing world. But much to their founders’ consternation, their publicly listed shares fail fully to reflect this. There’s no quick fix, unfortunately. Complexity, lack of clear reporting and poor corporate governance are all to blame.
Shares in the likes of KKR and Blackstone in theory should prove attractive: the sheer growth in assets under management is bringing strong growth in base management fees, which these firms collect...
